bug.author: eaporetsky
bug.summary: Spacy 2.3 'with nlp.disable_pipes()' does not properly restore the pipes.
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>How to reproduce the behaviour</denchmark-h>
When I run the example <denchmark-link:https://spacy.io/usage/training/#example-train-ner>https://spacy.io/usage/training/#example-train-ner</denchmark-link> with a pretrained model the does not get properly closed and the saved model only has the component, not the tagger and parser. However if I do the normal disable flow without the context manager it works fine. Seems like a bug to me but wondering if others can reproduce. <denchmark-h:h2>Your Environment</denchmark-h>
spaCy version: 2.3.0 Platform: Darwin-18.6.0-x86_64-i386-64bit Python version: 3.7.7

comments.comment:
Thanks for the report! I screwed up the syntax when I added the warnings filter. It should be fixed now in by <denchmark-link:https://github.com/explosion/spaCy/pull/5690>#5690</denchmark-link> , so if you look at the current version it should be correct: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/explosion/spaCy/blob/master/examples/training/train_ner.py>https://github.com/explosion/spaCy/blob/master/examples/training/train_ner.py</denchmark-link>
(Permalink: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/explosion/spaCy/blob/2bd78c39e33b90f788b1121b93b3b098c4c4af10/examples/training/train_ner.py>https://github.com/explosion/spaCy/blob/2bd78c39e33b90f788b1121b93b3b098c4c4af10/examples/training/train_ner.py</denchmark-link> )
Should be fixed so closing this - but do let us know if you still run into issues with the new version on master !
